Caprino is a cheese made from goat's milk. Caprino Fresco, a fresh version of caprino is aged for three-four days has a soft creamy texture. The cheese usually has a round or cylindrical shape. It is often sold wrapped in paper or immersed in olive oil especially when shipped for preservation.

Pecorino represents a class of Italian sheep's milk cheeses—it can be traced back as far as 900 BC. There are many varieties of pecorino, each representing its region of origin and showcasing the terroir within its flavor. This version comes from Calabria in Southern Italy.
